name: Fairmont Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fairmont has again lived up to its name. I have spent time in Canada staying at Fairmonts in 2004 and this one in Asia is no different. Neat, spotless, modern rooms with all amenites that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Staff in the whole of the hotel are sweet and nothing is a problem for them. The hotel is above a shopping plaza which includes a supermarket and for those who love shopping, just step out of the foyer and there you go SHOPS..GO GIRLS!!! The hotel is located next to Raffles and you must go to the Long Bar for a Singapore Sling just for the experience. The hotel is just above the MRT which is a cheap way to get around the city, maximum s$1.80 for a one way trip. Orchard road is great for shopping, but I loved Little India, Kampong Glam & China Town. Eating is very cheap especially when you eat where the locals eat. Newton Circus is a must specialising in seafood. The locals are in a league of their own...the nicest, friendliest people on the planet who will help you even if you kind of look lost!!!!
reviews.title: beautiful, SAFE Singapore

reviews.text: We stayed here on a 4-day family holiday with our baby. We had previously stayed at the Swissotel the Stamford which is actually in the same hotel-shopping mall complex as the Fairmont. We liked the Swissotel for its great location, and decided to stay at the Fairmont this time because we had a better deal for it on Expedia and it was essentially the same location.
reviews.title: Great location, decent hotel, shame about the room cleaning (or lack of it)

reviews.text: Perfect location right in the middle of the hotel district, although even the best rooms do not have sea view. That is to say, our view was impeccable - and having upgraded we had the pleasure of views on two sides.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, location, rooms

reviews.text: The service is impeccable, things work - and the full lobby during mornings and nights gives a feeling of a busy, popular hotel.
reviews.title: Great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a quick 2 night stopover and found the Fairmont great for our needs. It was located in a mall with all the shops i needed. Checked in at 2:00 am and Joanne at the desk was very cheerful. The room was of a good size for Singapore but it was a bit dated with stains on the curtains and the bed sheets had a hole in them.
reviews.title: stay in south wing with harbour view only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone in the hotel was very helpful and cheerful. Thomas, who came to get the bags at check out was darling. Had the taxi ready loaded by the time I got outside. Just great service.
reviews.title: Third time stay - enjoyed every minute!

reviews.text: I was surprised that the Fairmont has rooms called 'the Fairmont room' in the north wing, which must be the old wing, that are worn out and bleak.
reviews.title: A 'normal' 5 star in a decent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect. Thankyou.
reviews.title: Great start to our Honeymoon and fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room had such a magnificent view over the city and we loved the remote curtains. As it was our Honeymoon as soon as we arrived in the room we were sent flowers, chocolates and a congratulatory card. Such a nice touch.
reviews.title: average, after all the anticipation

reviews.text: The location is central and taxis are really reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location, very comfy beds

reviews.text: location is great, the hotel is located in a major shopping centre, very convenient. check-in was quick, staff is friendly. stayed in the south wing, room is very pretty but so are those in other five-star hotels, so service is an important factor to be outstanding.
reviews.title: A1 in all areas

reviews.text: this stay i so look forward to after learning all the good reviews, was disappointing.
reviews.title: Unsurpassed Service and Thoughtfulness

reviews.text: believe the reviews on here, the Fairmont was a great place to stay with young kids, for the pool alone, which has a shallow section that our one year old could walk around in happily, kind of big paddling pool and swimming pool in one. Breakfast by the pool was the biggest treat. Staff all lovely, rooms a bit executive/dark, but great views of the cityscape and the new Marina Sands boat building. All needs catered for by teh shopping centre attached. No negatives really, I would say spend a couple of days here as a stopover on the way to Aus with kids as we did, it'll make the whole thing much less painful!
reviews.title: fab as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: friendly reception upgraded are room great location. great pool, first rate breakfast excellent stay
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Excellent service, pleasant ambience, hugely spacious rooms and a great pool. Slight unpleasant smell of drains in the bathroom would be my only gripe. Nice location too. Recommended.
reviews.title: Very good...

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel 3 separate times in the months of March and April as part of a larger business trip across Asia. After staying at a couple of other properties I settled at the Fairmont and it eventually became my top choice in Singapore.
reviews.title: My favorite stay in Singapore.

reviews.text: The service at the hotel is impeccable. Everyone from the check-in to the room service staff to the bellman gave excellent service at all times. I thought that in many cases the service was not only excellent, but on a more personal basis than at some of the other 5-star hotels in town. For example, I was able to leave a large suitcase at the hotel over the weekend while taking a short weekend trip, and the staff asked me about where I went, how I liked it, etc. I felt valued as a customer here and thought that this set the hotel apart.
reviews.title: Great place and great value for money

reviews.text: We (family of 2 adults & 2 boys aged 8 & 4) spent 8 nights at the Fairmont. The service was fantastic (prompt responses to requests, recognition of our boys) and although our room wasn't set up with the 2 double beds as we'd planned that was quickly rectified by bringing in 2 fold away beds (worked better!). As it was also my birthday the room was beautifully presented with petals spelling out a message, cake and a bottle of wine - nice touch.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Our room was obviously not one that has been recently renovated but that was more than compensated for with the amazing view over the hotel's pools towards Marina Bay Sands - stunning at night with the laser show.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location over the Raffles City shopping mall was perfect as we could buy breakfast easily (some stores open early enough for breakfast) and stock up on other food and drink items at The Market Place (stored in our fridge that had been cleared of all mini bar items). The complimentary bottled water was also most welcome.
reviews.title: Luxury, elegance and wonderful service in a great location

reviews.text: The Fairmont is situated an easy walking distance from Suntec Mall and Marina Square through the Citylink airconditioned, underground walk ways and to Makansutra Gluttons Bay for Hawker Centre type food.
reviews.title: Cant beat this hotel!

reviews.text: It was only a few minutes wait for a taxi each time we needed one (if one wasn't there one was whistled over promptly) and the MRT station City Hall is connected to Raffles City.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient - Great Stay

reviews.text: I stayed a week on corporate rate at the fairmont south tower in a standard room in early february.
reviews.title: good for business
Adequate...
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Fairmont. We were upgraded from a ‘Deluxe’ room to an ‘Executive’ Room on the 22nd Floor. This entitled us to enjoy the ‘Executive Club’, a lounge offering all-day snacks and free cocktails in the evening- no kids allowed. We have 2 young ones so no value to us. There is also a small gym up there for ‘Executive’ guests. The room was fine- modern décor, surround sound, flat screen TV, electric curtains, etc.. Nice spacious modern bathroom, king-size shower. We think it a waste to have all linen changed every day but there is really no option but to have ones towels replaced every day as nowhere to hang them up, simply a large basket to throw them in!

We had booked a room with king-size bed (and cot) but were given 2 doubles. Best they could do was push doubles together and make up bed with king-size linen. Coffee/tea making facilities- there is a smart expresso machine. If, like us, you drink tea, take your tea bags with you. The 2 provided don’t go far! The cups are designed for an expresso from the coffee maker so you could just about use one bag for 2 cups (there is all-day coffee and tea from the ‘Executive Club’ (if you don’t have kids!)). With our air con set to its lowest speed and highest temperature (30degC) we were freezing. The ‘engineer’ was assigned to fix this. The following night with the air con set at its highest speed and lowest temperature (20degC) we were in a sauna bath. The following day the ‘engineer’ returned- we then returned to the arctic and simply decided to ‘rug-up’. At least we could open the door on to the little balcony- something you cannot often do in high-rise hotels. Our package included breakfast. Breakfast is standard hotel buffet style. Seems like hotels try to outdo each other for the most obscure dishes for breakfast- you look at half this stuff and wonder just WHO would want THAT for breakfast. If you came down from Mars there’d be something you’d like. No particular reflection on this hotel in particular (there almost ALL the same) but is anyone else out there sick of the breakfast offering of leather for bacon and sausages that look more like they’re boiled than grilled or fried? Whilst I’m about it has anyone ever met one of those motorised toaster machines that makes a piece of toast (as opposed to warmed bread) in one ‘pass’? Singapore hotels cater for a very cosmopolitan clientele including many UK/American & Australasian clients. Amongst the okra sambal, the sio mai, chicken curry, steamed pork buns, chick pea curry and miso soup there was nothing as simple as baked beans in tomato sauce. On one morning only were there some soggy little hash browns. Amongst the salads, dozens of cold meats and cheeses and fruits I had never even seen before there were no mushrooms sautéed, grilled or cooked by any means whatsoever. Take the tea… the coffee is well and truly stewed.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel & Service

reviews.text: The hotel pool on the 8th floor is great and good for kids including our littlies. There is a separate kids’ pool.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.disliked: — Unable to take advantage of balcony due to noisy shopping centre air conditioning. Bad plumbing and tiling in bathroom.

reviews.text: The concierge was helpful & forthcoming on tourist info except when we sought info on the harbour cruise. He sent us off to the Esplanade (20 minute walk) which is where he had advised the boats left from. With 2 little kids in tow we trudged the length of the Esplanade. We had another 20 minute walk to the ‘merlion’ fountain to find where the boats actually DO leave from.
reviews.title: NIce Amenities and Pool Area

reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmount in December 07 during 7 nights. Halfway through the week, it went from being called the Raffles Plaza to become the Fairmount.
reviews.title: Not a 5-star, but a good 4-star

likes.liked: — The food and drinks at the Raffles Inc. lounge

reviews.text: I stayed on the Raffles Inc. floor (25th or 26th floor) in the North Tower. It was a huge corner room with big 2 big balconies (1 towards CHIJMES and the other towards the Financial District) and great finishings. I did not see the issues other reviewers saw about tired carpeting and bathroom, everything looked renovated (and trust me that I looked).
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expect to be blown away by 5-star hotels. This hotel is a 4-star level.
reviews.title: Hospitality Plus

reviews.text: The biggest complaint is that the internet service was not free. One had to call reception, get a code, enter it everyday (and some days it did not work, but we were reimbursed), and I don't remember the price but it was not cheap. For a high-tech country like Singapore, that is just ridiculous. Sure we had access to the internet in the business lounge, but who wants to wait around for a computer to free up and have people lurking around?
reviews.title: mmm... not that good, average

likes.liked: — service in the restaurant by the pool
likes.disliked: — front desk, manager on duty by 17:00, clean service, too noisy

reviews.text: I loved the mattress and the electronic controls in the room. A few disappointments when the hotel changed management: 1/ the bath supplies offered by Raffles were more exotic and luxurious than the ones offered by Fairmount, 2/ No more chocolates on my pillow! 3/The turndown service became less efficient.
reviews.title: Sick of the North Tower...

likes.disliked: — Noise, dirty linens, ineffective AC, dreadful hard beds

description: The Fairmont Singapore hotel is ideally situated at the crossroads of Singapore's business, cultural, entertainment and shopping districts. It offers 769 luxurious guestrooms and suites, a collection of 16 distinctive restaurants and bars and 70,000 square feet of prime meeting space - all supported by our Singapore hotel's award-winning service teams.In addition, guests of Fairmont Singapore have access to the Willow Stream Spa, one of the largest spa facilities in Asia, offering the best in spa and fitness services.
